title: How to Change the Background on an iPhone: Complete Guide

steps.title: Open the Settings .
steps.content: Open the Settings . This is the cog icon. Make sure to update your iPhone to get all the latest wallpaper customization options.

steps.title: Tap Wallpaper.
steps.content: Tap Wallpaper . You can find this underneath Accessibility .

steps.title: Tap + Add New Wallpaper.
steps.content: Tap + Add New Wallpaper . This is the blue button.

steps.title: Select a photo for your wallpaper.
steps.content: Select a photo for your wallpaper. With the new iOS update, you have quite a few options to choose from. When you select an option, a preview will open. Tap Photos to set a single photo as your wallpaper. Tap Photo Shuffle to set a series of photos as your wallpaper. You can also select a wallpaper from the categories below: Featured, Weather & Astronomy, Kaleidoscope, Emoji, Unity, Pride, Collections, and Color.

steps.title: Customize your wallpaper.
steps.content: Customize your wallpaper. You can add widgets , set styles, and use filters.

steps.title: Tap Add.
steps.content: Tap Add . This is in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Set as Wallpaper Pair.
steps.content: Tap Set as Wallpaper Pair . If you want your home screen and lock screen to have different backgrounds, tap Customize Home Screen instead and select a new photo.

steps.title: Unlock your iPhone.
steps.content: Unlock your iPhone. Enter your passcode , Face ID, or touch ID. Your iPhone must be unlocked to edit the lock and home screen. Stay on the lock screen; don't swipe up just yet.

steps.title: Long-press on the lock screen.
steps.content: Long-press on the lock screen. When your iPhone is unlocked, this will open the Edit menu. If you have more than one wallpaper added, swipe left or right to find it.

steps.title: Tap Customize.
steps.content: Tap Customize . This is below the wallpaper you want to customize. The Customize view will open with the current lock screen on the left and the home screen on the right. If you want to set a new wallpaper, tap the blue + icon. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Customize your wallpaper.
steps.content: Customize your wallpaper. You can add widgets , set styles, and use filters. You won't be able to edit the wallpaper for some premade selections. In this case, delete the wallpaper and add a new one. Long-press on your lock screen and swipe up on the background. Tap the trash can icon, then tap Delete This Wallpaper .

steps.title: Go to your wallpaper's customization screen.
steps.content: Go to your wallpaper's customization screen. You can do this by long-pressing the lock screen (unlocked) and tapping Customize . You can also go to Settings → Wallpaper → Customize .

steps.title: Add widgets.
steps.content: Add widgets. On the lock screen, this can be found below the time. Tapping it will bring up all possible widgets you can add. Tap a widget to add it to the widget box. Keep in mind you can only add what fits in the box. This can be four small-sized widgets, 1 medium-sized and 2 small-sized, or another combination of widgets. You can also add certain widgets to the date line. Tap the date, and then tap a widget. On the home screen, long-press the wallpaper until the icons wiggle. Tap the + in the top-left corner to open the widget menu. Tap a widget to add it to your home screen.

steps.title: Add a filter.
steps.content: Add a filter. Swipe left and right to select between the filters. You can choose Natural, Black & White, Duotone, or Color Wash. If you choose Duotone or Color Wash, tap the color bubble in the bottom-right corner and select a style color.

steps.title: Add a font style.
steps.content: Add a font style. Tap the time at the top of the screen. A pop-up window will open. Select a font style from the preset. You can tap and drag towards the left to see more options. Drag the slider to change your font size. Select a color style at the bottom to change the font color.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This will save your changes.

steps.title: Turn on your device and let it load into your lock screen.
steps.content: Turn on your device and let it load into your lock screen.

steps.title: Long-press on the lock screen until the screen has several large tiles, and a Customize button appears at the bottom.
steps.content: Long-press on the lock screen until the screen has several large tiles, and a Customize button appears at the bottom. By holding your finger down on the wallpaper, you will access the lock screen settings to delete. The deletion of wallpapers is no longer an option from the Settings app. However, you can remove them via this method.

steps.title: Find the wallpaper you'd like to remove.
steps.content: Find the wallpaper you'd like to remove. Slide left and right between wallpapers to see how they display.

steps.title: Grab from the bottom of the wallpaper display and swipe it upwards until a red trash can button displays.
steps.content: Grab from the bottom of the wallpaper display and swipe it upwards until a red trash can button displays.

steps.title: Tap the red trash can button.
steps.content: Tap the red trash can button.

steps.title: Confirm your choice.
steps.content: Confirm your choice. This original dialog box asks whether you're okay with your choice for deleting it from both your Lock and Home screens. Tap "Delete This Wallpaper to confirm.
